intro: Quercus liboensis, commonly known as the Libo oak, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its lobed leaves and produces acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. The botanical features of Quercus liboensis make it an ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
